result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/11/22
Jury trial - 12 person on December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.

11:40 AM Defendant Anthony D Pierce in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Anthony D Pierce.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense filed a speedy trial demand in 22CF885 and 22CF1457 on 9/28/22.
Parties agree that the deadline for the speedy trial is 12/27/22.
Defense is not moving for joinder.
State may file a joinder motion and requests time to decide.
State to file a joinder motion, if any, by 10/20/22.  
Defense to file a response by 11/3/22.
State to file a reply by 11/10/22.
Court will set aside time for the motion hearing now.
Court will set both cases for the same trial dates at this time.
All traffic matters to tag along.
Each jury trial expected to last 2 days.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Each side is entitled to 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order for each case.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Filed in Court by defense on 09-28-2022

9:16 AM Defendant Anthony D Pierce in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Anthony D Pierce. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Erik Hendriksen , of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Hoffmann.  
Cross examination by attorney Gutierrez.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over without argument.  
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Defense enters demand for speedy trial.  
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 9/19/22 - defendant asking for speedy trial

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 23, 2022 - Schedule after preliminary.**
Letter to Court dated September 21, 2022 re: Requesting Preliminary Hearing within Time Limits
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Luis Gutierrez
Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 9/14/22

The original history event date is: 09-14-2022

proposed protective order
The original document was titled: proposed protective order
The original history event date is: 09-14-2022

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony D Pierce
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2022)
Prior: 3319 S Wollmer Rd, West Allis, WI 53227

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A and witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

2:32 PM Defendant Anthony D Pierce in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Anthony D Pierce.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
